timeline.message: Add key count parameter to MetadataManager#getExipedOpenKeys
Account for count parameter in OmMetadataManager#getExpiredOpenKeys
Add count parameter for maximum number of open keys to return to KeyManager

Create draft of unit test for getExpiredOpenKeys

Add the ability to manually set the creation time of OmKeyInfo objects for testing.
Unit test for OmMetadataManagerImpl#getExpiredOpenKeys implemented and passing
Create open key names using existing helper method instead of manually

Merge branch 'master' into HDDS-4121

* master:
  HDDS-4111. Keep the CSI.zh.md consistent with CSI.md (#1320)
  HDDS-3654. Let backgroundCreator create pipeline for the support replication factors alternately (#984)
  HDDS-4112. Improve SCM webui page performance (#1323)
  HDDS-4074. [OFS] Implement AbstractFileSystem for RootedOzoneFileSystem (#1330)
  HDDS-4144. Update version info in hadoop client dependency readme (#1348)
  HDDS-4139. Update version number in upgrade tests (#1347)
Clean up changes after viewing diffs with master

timeline.bodyText: Here, we can collect just expired KeyNames.
timeline.author: bharatviswa504
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -186,10 +186,11 @@ OmKeyLocationInfo allocateBlock(OmKeyArgs args, long clientID,
    * the key name and all its associated block IDs. A pending open key has
    * prefix #open# in OM DB.
    *
+   * @param count The maximum number of expired opne keys to return.
    * @return a list of {@link BlockGroup} representing keys and blocks.
    * @throws IOException
    */
-  List<BlockGroup> getExpiredOpenKeys() throws IOException;
+  List<BlockGroup> getExpiredOpenKeys(int count) throws IOException;

replies.bodyText: And also I think we might need last expired key also, as in next iteration we need to start from that one.
replies.author: bharatviswa504

replies.bodyText: You can ignore my 2nd comment, as delete expiredKeys will be done in a single iteration, those expired keys will not be there in the openKeyTable.
replies.author: bharatviswa504

timeline.author: bharatviswa504

    * the key name and all its associated block IDs. A pending open key has
    * prefix #open# in OM DB.
    *
+   * @param count The maximum number of expired opne keys to return.

timeline.bodyText: Is this line in the original documentation still relevant? It looks like open keys are placed in the open key table unprefixed.
timeline.author: errose28

timeline.message:
Apply fixes from pull request comments

Make getOpenExpiredKeys return a list of string key name strings instead of BlockGroups.
Fix documentation typo.
